summary: Email correspondence from July 13, 2019, discussing scheduling a meeting with a former Epstein associate and her sister, who may have information about coercive sexual encounters, and referencing a publicist, R. Couri Hay, who had recent conversations with Epstein about his reputation. The email includes discussion of issuing a subpoena.

persons.name: R. Couri Hay
persons.context: Referenced as having had recent conversations with Jeffrey Epstein about Epstein's reputation and prior conduct, where Epstein asserted his conviction did not constitute pedophilia.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigation; referenced as having discussed his reputation and prior conduct with publicist R. Couri Hay, claiming his conviction did not involve pedophilia.

connections.description: Epstein discussed his reputation and prior conduct with Hay, who declined to represent him.

events.title: Meeting planning with Epstein associates
events.description: Planning to schedule a meeting with a former Epstein associate and possibly her younger sister, who may have information about coercive sexual encounters with Epstein and/or his associates.

events.title: Epstein conversation with R. Couri Hay
events.description: Epstein had a conversation with publicist R. Couri Hay about improving his reputation, asserting his prior conviction did not constitute pedophilia.

keyFacts: Investigators planned to meet with a former Epstein associate and her younger sister, who may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters with Epstein and/or his associates.
Publicist R. Couri Hay had recent conversations with Epstein where Epstein claimed his conviction did not involve pedophilia, describing the girls as 'tweens and teens'.
The email discusses issuing a subpoena to R. Couri Hay if he does not agree to an informal interview.
The correspondence is from July 2019, shortly before Epstein's arrest and death, indicating ongoing investigative activity.
